0001: Fewer than 12 points and not suitable for a weak opening, <red>Pass</red>.
0003: Balanced or semi-balanced hand with 20 to 22 points, <red>2NT</red>.
0004: Unbalanced hand, 12 to 22 points or balanced hand with 15 to 19 points: <red>1 of longest suit</red>.
0005: Very strong hand with 23 points or more, or hand that you wish to force to game, 2♣.
0006:
With 12 to 19 points and two 5 card suits, open the higher ranking suit.

(If the 5 card suits are ♠ and ♣, open 1♣).
0008: Acol light opener with a 6 card suit and 11 points, <red>1 of longest suit</red>.
0010: 12 to 20 points unbalanced hand or outside NT range with two 4 card minors, <red>1C</red>.
0011:
Weak with 6 to 10 points and a 6 card suit, 2 of that suit.
(With 6-6 (rare) open the higher ranking suit.)
0012: A 7 card suit and 0-9 points,  <red>3 of long suit</red> (preemptive).
0013: Fewer than 11 points, not suitable for weak take-out, <red>Pass</red>.
0014:
weak and a 5+card suit,

2 of suit

(weak take-out; hand not suitable for NT).
0016: 19+ points and a six card major: <red>4 of major</red>.
0023: No support for partner, but 12+ points, <red>DOUBLE</red>.
0025: No support for partner and 6-15 points: <red>longest (biddable) suit at lowest level</red>. <li>Bid 4 card suits in ascending order;<li>bid 5 card suits in descending order.
0026: With 19+ points: <red>bid to game in suit</red>.
0027: Fewer than 16 points and no support for partner, <red>Pass</red>
0030: Support for partner and 16+ points: <red>jump in partner's suit</red>.
0035: Fewer than 10 points and 2+ card support: <red>4 of suit</red> (preemptive raise).
0036: With a 7 card suit and 8+ points: <red>2 of longest suit</red>.
0037: Fewer than 15 points and no support, <red>Pass</red>
0040: With 12 points or poor hand with 13 points: <red>Pass</red>
0044: Response to Stayman, with no 4 card major: 2<red>♦</red>.
0045: Partner has bid game. No slam interest: <red>Pass</red>
0046: Support for partners major: <red>4 of major</red>.
0047: With fewer than 3 card support for partner's major, <red>3NT</red>
0048: Unbalanced hand. <red>Show second suit at appropriate level.</red>.
0049: Support for partner and 13+ points (include shortage and/or length points): <red>bid game</red>.
0052:
Responses to Blackwood,
  • 0 and 4 aces, 5C;
  • 1 ace, 5D;
  • 2 aces, 5H;
  • 3 aces, 5S.
0053:
No support for partner or partner has opened with a minor, 9+ points: 1 (or 2 if necessary) of longest suit.

(NB 1♠ followed by 2♥ usually promises 5+♥s .)
0054: With 3+ card support for partner's major: <red>raise partner's suit</red>.
0055: Partner has passed and unable to compete: <red>Pass</red>
0057: Support for partner and a very strong hand: <red>bid to game</red>.

Partner has shown support, or you have 4 of partner's suit and 19+ points,

bid game in partner's suit.

0063: With 15+ points and 1+ card support for a major: <red>4 of major</red>.
0066: Partner has indicate a strong hand and stopper in bid suits: <red>3NT</red>.
0067: Minimum hand or no 5+ card suit. Cannot show second suit: <red>Pass</red>.
0069:
Part has jumped in your suit.

No support for partner.

With 10 or fewer points, Pass.

Partner has broken the barrier showing 16+ points and a 5/4 hand.

.
